chunks.en: Does anyone have a hobby of collecting charging heads?
RT, how much money have you spent on this in the last two years?
Can you help me analyze the psychology behind this fetish?
To put it bluntly, is it because they can't perform and, being horny all the time, they start doing these weird things?
There's no positive feedback from being a simp, so now I'm obsessed with VPS soft routing VPN, and I especially like measuring latency. The lower the latency, the more pleasure I get.ğŸ˜…

@abdullahizaki "I've noticed a pattern: generally, the older men get, the less interested they are in being simps... Simp behavior peaks between 20 and 25 years old. Men after 30 start buying weird things... On this forum, I've seen people buying fishing gear, tea, beads, and the most outrageous is someone who's addicted to charging heads..." It should be this.
@MENGKE Shocked! Have I reached the grandmaster level? To bask in the sun comfortably, I can drive to nearby cities with sunshine on rainy days. ğŸ˜„
Not mine, it's a picture I saved before.
Cyber middle-aged men's three hobbies: router, NAS, charging head.
Just collecting charging heads is not enough, you have to prepare several fast charging cables. Now Luxshare's USB3 cables and HP's disassembled Thunderbolt 4 cables have good prices.
Actually, collecting various sizes of charging heads isn't really collecting, I guess the above person that collected 4 5V1A can be considered collecting.

The reason people like to buy charging heads of all sizes is simply that the standard for buying charging heads has changed from "necessary" to "the newly released charging head solves a pain point." For example, some people don't want to carry a brick-sized laptop charger, so they buy a gallium nitride charger.

For example, I think charging heads with USB output direction parallel to the 220V plug are easy to fall off when plugged into the wall, and I don't want to bring multiple charging heads when I go out with too many devices, so I bought a multi-port charger.
And I don't want to carry a charger everywhere, so I put one next to my computer, bedside, and office, so naturally I need to buy one or two more small ones.
Sure enough, middle-aged men all have hobbies.
Post the pictures; let us observe, this is the first time I've heard of it.

I don't have an interest in collecting charging heads. I'm curious, do you have so many devices that need fast charging? If you don't change your phone and computer every year, they are basically bound to fast charging.

chunks.en: However, I have a similar hobby, which is collecting USB multi-port chargers, because there are many electronic devices that are USB powered, and the power is not high (headphones, bracelets, universal remote control, air detection....). I upgraded from a five-port USB charger to a 12-port USB output.
I also upgraded the type-c cable from a single one to one-to-three (I don't know if there is one-to-five)
Three great loves of middle age: router, NAS, charging head.
Baseus' gallium nitride is really exquisite... I basically buy every new product.
I like to collect notebooks, yes, those that cost a few dollars each and can be written on.
Every time I go to the supermarket, I buy different ones, plus the ones issued by the company and given by customers, and now there is a large cabinet at home.
I've also given away a lot. I feel that each book has a different place, so I just want to collect them.
@Sosocould For people who just use them, stability and smoothness are enough, but for middle-aged men, parameter indicators are a kind of fetish.ğŸ˜µğŸ˜µ
Middle-aged men's three hobbies: NAS, soft router, charging head.

Does anyone like to collect various bracelets? Over the years, I have collected turquoise, Southern Red Agate, Pixiu, golden Kirin, cliff cypress, agarwood, giant clam, etc., and spent tens of thousands of dollars.
Did you collect various cards when you were a kid?
I would buy them to use, but not to collect.
